description.narrative: Purple Roof Women's Shelter Foundation (Mor Çati) har inkommit med en ansökan till Sida om 16,2 miljoner SEK för finansiering av deras strategiska plan 2020-2022 (avtalets aktivitetsperiod juli 2020 - juni 2023). Insatsens avser stärka kampen mot våld mot kvinnor i Turkiet, påverka offentlig politik i syfte att stärka och förbättra stödmekanismer för kvinnor som utsatts för våld samt att öka allmänhetens medvetenhet om jämställdhet och om frågor rörande våld mot kvinnor. Insatsens totala budget är cirka 22,4 miljoner SEK, varav 6,2 miljoner SEK kommer från andra europeiska givare, inklusive Europeiska Kommissionen och den Nederländska ambassaden.

Purple Roof Women’s Shelter Foundation has applied to Sida for funding of SEK 16,2 Million for their strategic plan 2020-2023 (agreement's activity period July 2020 - June 2023). The intervention aims to strengthen the struggle against Violence against Women (VAW) in Turkey, influence public policies to strengthen and improve support mechanisms for women victims of VAW, as well as to raise public awareness on gender equality and VAW. The intervention’s total budget is approximately SEK 22,4 Million, out of which 6,2 million SEK is contributed by other European donors including European Commission and the Embassy of the Netherlands.

Strategic Objectives: Strategic Objective 1: Increase women’s solidarity to strengthen the struggle against VAW in Turkey Strategic Objective 2: Influence public policies to strengthen and improve support mechanisms to women for combatting with VAW Strategic Objective 3: Raising public awareness on gender equality and VAW

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

tag.narrative: 5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: It is assessed that PR will be able to achieve their results despite the challenges in their environment. Their theory of change is still valid and also being improved with the RBM support they are receiving from Sida, especially in the monitoring and reporting work. The risk assessment provided is very broad and realistic and is also updated according to the developments as external risks.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
